Problem:
class MusicPlayer { constructor(volume) { this.volume = volume; } increaseVolume() { if (this.volume < 100) { this.volume += 10; } } decreaseVolume() { if (this.volume > 0) { this.volume -= 10; } } setVolume(newVolume) { if (newVolume >= 0 && newVolume <= 100) { this.volume = newVolume; } else { throw new Error('Volume must be between 0 and 100.'); } } status() { return `Volume is currently at ${this.volume}.`; } } const player = new MusicPlayer(20); player.increaseVolume(); console.log(player.status());",

If the volume was initially set at 20, and the method increaseVolume is called, will the status message show a volume of 30?
Explanation: Calling increaseVolume on a volume of 20 increases it by 10. The subsequent call to status() will reflect this update, showing a volume of 30.

causal_map_integration: When the increaseVolume method is called, the volume increases by 10 if it is less than 100.
